uk.ac.aber.dcs.cs12420.aberpizza.gui

Class OrderDisplayPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • uk.ac.aber.dcs.cs12420.aberpizza.gui.OrderDisplayPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class OrderDisplayPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Displays a list of all items currently in an order in a list box. Also allows the user to change the quantity of an item added to the order using the list box component. Contained within DisplayBasePanel.
    Author:
    Connor Goddard (clg11)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                 DisplayBasePanel displayPan)

        tillObject - The Till data object passed down from TillFrame

    • Method Detail

      • initComponents

        public void initComponents()
        Initialises the panel components (including linking components to listeners where required) before adding the components to the panel.

      • updateList

        public void updateList()
        Updates the list box display to reflect any changes to the items in the order (e.g. new item added/removed) by re-looping through updated item array list and populating list box with updated information.

      • setListTitle

        public void setListTitle(java.lang.String customerName)
        Sets the customer name display to the name of the customer that holds the order. Creates and adds a pre-defined header to the order list box display.
        Parameters:
        customerName - The name of the customer that the order is for/

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the components in the panel ready for a new order.

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Listener for mouse actions that interact with the list box display. Used to change the quantity of an item.
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        evt - - ActionEvent called from the list box that require an action to be performed.
